rationale: This species is widespread in the region with no known major threats. It is classified as Least Concern

taxonomicnotes: The taxonomy of Amphilius uranoscopous is under revision. Many isolated populations of Amphilius catfishes occur in southern and central Africa. There is usually considerable colour pattern and morphological variation between these populations.
rationale: Despite threats to certain populations, this species is abundant and has a wide distribution. It is therefore listed as Least Concern. It has also been assessed regionally as Least Concern for central, eastern and southern Africa.
assessor: Bills, R., Cambray, J., Hanssens, M. & Marshall, B.
evaluator: Snoeks, J., Tweddle, D., Getahun, A., Lalèyè, P., Paugy, D., Zaiss, R., Fishar, M.R.A & Brooks, E.
